description: Council bosses in the Spanish city of Alcala de Henares have been forced to apologise after footage emerged of council workers hiring a stripper (pictured) for a retirement party.
title: Spanish council left red-faced after ‘hiring a stripper
title_page: Spanish council left red-faced after ‘hiring a stripper | Daily Mail Online
text:
Office parties can sometimes get a little out of hand.
But one council in Spain has found itself in hot water after taking celebrations a bit too far - by hiring a stripper to perform at a retirement party.
Now local council bosses from the city of Alcala de Henares, on the outskirts of Madrid, have been forced to issue a grovelling apology after footage of the 'festivities ' went viral.
In the video a man, alleged to be a public servant, can be seen sitting in a chair with his shirt open as a scantily clad stripper performs her sexy routine all over him.
While dozens of his colleagues look on the stripper slowly takes off her 'secretary' outfit and gradually undresses him to a chorus of cheers.
The footage has enraged commentators online and has been viewed nearly 150,000 times since it was uploaded on March 14.
One viewer posted: 'To hell with the council! Using public buildings for private parties and showing us all their "feminism" by hiring strippers!'
The stripper went through her dance routine much to the delight of the (completely male) crowd
The sordid footage left viewers online outraged and council officials horrified
Another commented: 'Shameful. This is the way in which you defend women's equality. Hypocrites.'
Political factions in Alcala have been outraged by the sleazy affair according to the Local Spain, with some decrying how the local municipal office had been 'turned into a strip club'.
Miguel Angel Lezcano, the spokesman of the centrist political party Ciudadanos, said they want to know how much the party cost and who stumped up for the bill.
The council said they were working to find out the parties responsible for the embarrassing stunt
He said: 'It is unacceptable that this kind of thing happens in a town hall, which belongs to the people and is not a place for staging private parties.'
Council sources were horrified after footage went public and have vowed to get to the bottom of the matter, however the pixelated video makes it hard to identify specific workers.
One local politician demanded someone take 'political responsibility' for the party
In a statement to local media the council confirmed the party had taken place.
It said: 'This incident happened outside of working hours in a municipal building. It's normal to permit retirement parties [in the building] for work colleagues.
'In this case, the send-off devolved into a deplorable show.
'The council considers these acts lamentable and inexcusable. It's since acted firmly and forcefully to find out the responsible parties'.
